page.title: 03Local History - St Combs (2)
page.content: Because the{mouth of Strathbeg}was now blocked the sand built up along the coast and the fishermen found themselves farther and farther away from the coast.Because they could'nt go fishing they took to{poaching}the Lairds game.To get the fishermen off his land the{Laird paid 20 people each {Â£5}to build new houses nearer to the sea.They built their houses beside the old{kirk of St.Colm.}One fisherman did not receive any money so he went to the{neighbouring Laird for money. {He}built his house on the other side of the{March stream}thus founding {Charleston.
